SEARCH
Package gameplay

Class CombinationTest

java.lang.Object
gameplay.CombinationTest
public class CombinationTest extends Object
The CombinationTest class is responsible for testing the functionality of the Combination class, which represents combinations of cards in the Tichu card game. This test class utilizes JUnit and parameterized testing to cover various scenarios and combinations.

The tests cover the evaluation of different combinations, such as singles, pairs, following pairs, drills, full houses, straights, straight flushes, and more. Each test case includes the expected combination type, value, presence of the Phoenix card, and presence of the Dragon card.

This class is annotated with JUnit annotations for test execution, and it uses the Parameterized runner to run the parameterized tests with different input combinations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tömöri Péter

    • CombinationTest

      public CombinationTest(ArrayList<Card> clist, gameplay.ComboType t, int v, boolean p, boolean d)
      Constructs a new CombinationTest instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      clist - The list of cards to be used in the combination.
      t - The expected combination type.
      v - The expected value of the combination.
      p - Indicates whether the Phoenix card is expected to be in the combination.
      d - Indicates whether the Dragon card is expected to be in the combination.
